revised_title: Advances in Industrial Organic Chemical Processes
tldr: This article reviews recent developments in industrial organic chemistry, focusing on new processes for producing bulk organic chemical products. It discusses the importance of reactions involving hydrocarbons and oxygen, as well as the use of alternative raw materials and fewer reaction stages. The article highlights the production of acetic acid through various methods, including the oxidation of paraffin hydrocarbons and the reaction of methanol with carbon monoxide. It also covers the oxidation of secondary alcohols from n-paraffins and cyclohexane.
